channel.title: Since When...?
channel.description: Since when is it okay to choose not to follow rule number 3? In the last 5 minutes I've seen at least 10 posts containing moronic excuses for proper English, I tolerated it for a while just thinking it was a joke but now I see it everywhere, I don't have a problem with the people doing it I'd just rather see this forum look intelligent than retarded. Go ahead flame me for caring.

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Lothy:

Stupid reply - it should be obvious that I’m talking about sanctions on these forums for people that display blatant disrespect for the rules.

The way I understood your post, it was a general truth drawn from a specific problem.

Read full topic

That really depends. Nothing will ever be too harsh for some people.
[/quote]

I think murder is a great leveler.[/quote]
Stupid reply - it should be obvious that I’m talking about sanctions on these forums for people that display blatant disrespect for the rules.

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:27, topic:127400”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=178011.msg1640721#msg1640721 date=1185895428]
I think it should be enforced to an extent: if a staff member is reading a topic and they see some really stupid replies, then they should by all means mute the perpetrator/s. Who knows, it may act as a deterrent and the stupid posts may even cease to exist.
[/quote]

The green badge is enough. Muteing is harsh it’s like a temp ban.[/quote]
That really depends. Nothing will ever be too harsh for some people.

Read full topic

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @MybJames MybJames
item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:27, topic:127400”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=178011.msg1640721#msg1640721 date=1185895428]
I think it should be enforced to an extent: if a staff member is reading a topic and they see some really stupid replies, then they should by all means mute the perpetrator/s. Who knows, it may act as a deterrent and the stupid posts may even cease to exist.
[/quote]

The green badge is enough. Muteing is harsh it’s like a temp ban.

Who is really gonna help someone if they cany be bothered to type their sentances properly?

YA MAN I TTLY AGREE WIT U

The rule is against spelling mistakes on purpose. So Starblaster has done nothing wrong and I don’t know why you haven’t been punished.[/quote]
[/sarcasm]

Read full topic

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I think that if it gets excessive/out of control, then 1 day mutes would suffice. I think if every time somebody acts like a complete retard and gets a short mute for it, they will start to understand that they need to change their habits. It’s sort of like a slap on the wrists.

Read full topic

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I think Rule 2 has also been broken quite often. I have yet to see a mod or admin warn or ban for it.

I also notice that by saying something along the lines of, “Go ahead and flame me,” it actually deters people from flaming!

Read full topic

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Fr33sc4p3, post:14, topic:127400”]I don’t see a problem with it unless its in every post.

I mean its ok to joke around every know and again, but most of the time if i do it ill do it for a joke at the start then explain/talk on topic underneath it.[/quote]
I daresay it’s becoming a regular occurrence. I just left some moaning in two general discussion section topics. The whole section has been full of stupid and shit topics for weeks now; the occasional good topic is made every now and then, but it’s knocked down off the first page and into the cesspool within a few hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It won’t stop, because the rule isn’t enforced. It really is as simple as that: no sanction for breaking it, people see it as alright. Mind you, I do agree with you: it’s incredibly annoying to read sentences.

Read full topic

item.title: Since When...?
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

generally you can tell when they’re doing it on purpose to try to sound like “noobs”, or they are doing it on purpose just because they are so used to typing like that.

When they are so used to typing like that then it is very annoying. I admit i used to do it all the time. “tlk lyk dis constntly cos i cba 2 w8 2 rite da hole sentance” Now it takes me 20 minutes to understand one line.

Most of the time its done, as frank_ says, so you don’t take them seriously. However, when someone does want you to take them seriously and they type like that, it becomes very annoying. Who is really gonna help someone if they cany be bothered to type their sentances properly?

Read full topic
